description: {"blocks":[{"key":"4qq3f","text":"High Throughput Ligand Interaction Profiler (HT-LIP) is a web-based tool that runs on Google Colab, which allows users to predict ligand-protein interactions. HT-LIP can be used to screen large chemical libraries for potential drug candidates and can also provide  insights into potential ligand-protein interactions and identifies the interacting residues. HT-LIP can be useful in identifying potential binding sites and key residues for ligand-protein interactions, which can aid in drug discovery and protein-ligand interaction studies.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fvuke","text":"In your Google Drive home directory, create a new folder called “data”. Inside this folder, add 3 files.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1pi07","text":"(a) protein: in PDB format","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1hb1r","text":"(b) ligand: in SDF format","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a9kle","text":"(c) reference ligand: in PDB format","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9705t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d5ojo","text":"For example, the data folder created here, have files with the following names :","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c10ql","text":"(a) protein: 5Y15.pdb ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"406et","text":"(b) ligand: compounds_for_ml.sdf","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f8n4v","text":"(c) reference: reference_ligand.pdb","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4q9r6","text":"Click on the URL provided below to get started.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":47}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"endcr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c6fed","text":"URL: Google Colab Notebook","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":5,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":5,"length":21}],"data":{}},{"key":"97eu3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ei3tt","text":"Now, you will be directed towards the Google Colab Notebook. Towards the LHS side of the notebook, from the “files” section, click on the “mount drive” option. Then, a cell will be created, run the cell. Then click on “Run Anyway” and select “Connect to Google Drive” and give access. Now from the “drive” option, check whether the “data” folder created in the above step is seen in “MyDrive”.
